1526387869_12HSLurcaibJh4A44LGHoXm6cv6jA.body:
As the others already stated, it's not too late to start programming at your age. Personally I know a few people who started studying IT at a later age with less skills than you have gained already.
Regarding your uncertainty: There will always be somebody who's better at programming than you are and that's okay. They might be pros when it comes to technology, but you can have a better understanding of algorithms (or vice versa) for example. Last but not least: It's a great chance for you to learn from others.
Programming is a lot about curiosity and the desire of learning new things. Which is also necessary to keep up with new technologies, frameworks and so on.
